::: {style="text-align: justify"}
Iran Quality of Care in Medicine Program (IQCAMP) is a national pilot project aimed to evaluate the quality and cost of care for seven diseases with a high burden in Iran and around the globe. They are myocardial infarction, ischemic stroke, congestive heart failure, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, end-stage renal disease, major depression disorder, and diabetes mellitus. A cohort of about 300 patients was deemed to be sampled and followed up for three to six months. in this study I was a main statistician and my duty is cleaning the data and preparing the result. you can see the result of this study:
:::

<a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10060949/" target="_blank">Quality and cost of healthcare services in patients with diabetes in Iran: Results of a nationwide short-term longitudinal survey</a>
